Description: Fragment of lower wall of East Greek pottery bowl; interior glazed with added red band lined in white; exterior: key meander band at top, above black band with added red band probably lined in white; below, frieze containing goat to right, head turned back; pendant rosette above.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
In pencil on interior '3', deleted, and '6'.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 219, no. 63)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.680)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4801 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
